title: SyncScribe AI
description: AI meeting assistant with transcription, summarization, task extraction, and intelligent ranking workflow.
overview: SyncScribe AI is an intelligent meeting assistant that transforms how teams capture and act on meeting insights. It combines speech-to-text, natural language processing, and large language models to automatically transcribe meetings, generate concise summaries, extract actionable tasks, and prioritize them.
problem: Manual note-taking during meetings is time-consuming, error-prone, and causes participants to miss important discussions. Teams struggle to track action items and follow up effectively.

approach.etl: Built streaming ETL pipeline to process audio in real-time, chunk transcripts, and store in vector database
approach.cleaning: Applied text normalization, speaker diarization, and noise reduction to improve transcript quality
approach.modeling: Integrated Whisper for transcription, GPT-4 for summarization, and BERT for task extraction and ranking
approach.visualization: Created dashboard for meeting insights with task priority matrices and timeline views

challenges: Handling multiple speakers with overlapping speech, optimizing real-time processing latency, and ensuring accurate task prioritization across different meeting contexts.
learnings: Learned advanced prompt engineering for LLMs, implemented efficient vector search for semantic similarity, and gained experience with production ML systems.

title: TTC Subway Delay Prediction
description: End-to-end ML pipeline forecasting Toronto subway delays with 15% accuracy improvement.
overview: Built a comprehensive machine learning system to predict subway delays in Toronto's TTC network. The project combines historical delay data, weather patterns, and real-time events to forecast delays and help commuters plan better.
problem: TTC subway riders face unpredictable delays causing missed appointments and frustration. Historical data showed patterns but needed ML to predict future delays accurately.

approach.etl: Designed automated ETL pipeline on GCP to ingest daily delay records, weather data, and event information
approach.cleaning: Handled missing values, outlier detection, feature engineering (time-based, weather, station metrics)
approach.modeling: Tested Random Forest, XGBoost, LSTM models; ensemble approach yielded best results
approach.visualization: Built interactive dashboard showing delay predictions by line, station, and time of day

impact: Reduced average commute uncertainty by 12 minutes
challenges: Dealing with imbalanced dataset (more on-time than delayed), handling sudden unexpected events, and optimizing model inference for real-time predictions.
learnings: Mastered time series feature engineering, learned GCP data pipeline orchestration, and gained experience with ensemble modeling techniques.

title: Stock Forecasting with GNN + LSTM
description: Hybrid graph neural network and LSTM model for stock price prediction. Won hackathon with 18% accuracy improvement.
overview: Developed an innovative hybrid model combining Graph Neural Networks (GNN) and LSTM to capture both inter-stock relationships and temporal patterns. Won hackathon by demonstrating superior prediction accuracy over baseline models.
problem: Traditional stock prediction models treat each stock independently, missing crucial market interconnections. Need to model both stock relationships and time-series patterns simultaneously.

approach.etl: Built pipeline to fetch multi-stock data, compute correlation graphs, and create sliding windows for LSTM
approach.cleaning: Normalized prices, handled missing data, calculated technical indicators (RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands)
approach.modeling: GNN captures stock relationships, LSTM handles temporal sequences, combined via attention mechanism
approach.visualization: Interactive charts showing predictions vs actual, attention weights, and stock correlation networks

challenges: Balancing graph complexity with training time, selecting optimal stock graph topology, and preventing overfitting on historical patterns.
learnings: Deep dive into graph neural networks, learned attention mechanisms, and gained experience with hybrid deep learning architectures.

title: Uber Eats Analytics Dashboard
tagline: Big Data insights platform with interactive visualizations
description: Interactive dashboard analyzing Uber Eats restaurant data using Big Data tools (Hive, Spark, Zeppelin) with dynamic visualizations.
overview: A sleek and interactive Streamlit dashboard delivering insights from Uber Eats restaurant data. This project combines Big Data tools and data visualization to help users explore market trends, dish popularity, price ranges, and regional patterns.
problem: Food delivery platforms generate massive datasets, but extracting actionable insights for restaurant owners, analysts, and consumers requires efficient Big Data processing and intuitive visualization. Need to identify patterns in pricing, ratings, and regional food preferences at scale.

approach.etl: Built Big Data pipeline using Apache Hive and Spark to process large-scale restaurant data, with pre-computed aggregations stored in CSV format
approach.cleaning: Standardized restaurant categories, normalized price ranges, handled missing ratings, and aggregated state-level metrics
approach.modeling: Created interactive analysis views: top categories/dishes, price vs rating correlation, state-wise restaurant quality metrics
approach.visualization: Developed responsive Streamlit dashboard with Plotly charts for dynamic exploration of restaurant patterns and trends

impact: Processed large-scale restaurant dataset using distributed computing
Enabled interactive exploration of food delivery market trends
Provided insights for restaurant pricing and quality optimization
challenges: Processing large datasets efficiently with Hive/Spark, designing scalable data pipelines, and creating intuitive visualizations that handle dynamic filtering and user interactions.
learnings: Gained hands-on experience with Big Data technologies (Hive, Spark), learned to optimize data processing pipelines, and developed skills in building interactive dashboards with Streamlit and Plotly.
